  "description": "Domeo Resources International (DRI) is a prolific organisation which proffers HR and Management Consultancy solutions premised on excellence and innovation. We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Personal Assistant to the Managing Director (MD)
Job Location:&nbsp;Port Harcourt, Rivers
Reports To: Managing Director (MD)

Main Function


	The Personal Assistant (PA) to the MD will provide high-level executive support, enabling the MD to focus on strategic initiatives and business development.
	The ideal candidate is highly organised, resourceful, and adaptable, with excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
	The PA will act as a trusted liaison between the MD, internal stakeholders, and external partners while managing various administrative, operational, and strategic responsibilities.


Role Responsibilities
Administrative Support:


	Manage the MD&rsquo;s calendar, appointments, and meetings, ensuring effective time management and prioritisation.
	Handle all correspondence, including emails, phone calls, and messages, and respond on behalf of the MD when necessary.
	Organise travel arrangements, including itineraries, flight bookings, and accommodations.


Meeting Preparation &amp; Coordination:


	Prepare briefing materials, presentations, reports, and agendas for meetings and events.
	Attend meetings with or on behalf of the MD, taking detailed notes and following up on action points.
	Coordinate and manage logistics for internal and external meetings.


Project &amp; Task Management:


	Assist with the coordination of key projects and initiatives across the company&rsquo;s investment portfolio.
	Monitor deadlines, deliverables, and project timelines to ensure the MD stays informed and on schedule.


Stakeholder Liaison:


	Serve as the primary point of contact between the MD and stakeholders, including board members, business partners, government officials, and senior leadership.
	Facilitate the flow of information and ensure effective communication across departments.


Research &amp; Reporting:


	Conduct research and compile information on investment opportunities, industry trends, and other topics as requested by the MD.
	Draft reports, memos, and other business documents.


Event Coordination:


	Plan and coordinate corporate events, conferences, and social functions attended by the MD.


Experience / Qualification


	A bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Business Administration, Management, Communications, or a related field (A bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Law is preferred).
	At least 5 years of experience in a similar role providing executive support to C-suite executives or senior management, preferably in an investment, corporate, or high-growth environment.
	Experience working with high-level stakeholders, including government officials, investors, and corporate executives, is a plus.


Competencies / Skills:


	Excellent organizational and time management skills, with the ability to handle multiple priorities.
	Strong communication skills, both verbal and written.
	High level of professionalism and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build relationships across a diverse range of stakeholders.
	Proficiency in office tools such as Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and Google Workspace.
	Discretion and the ability to maintain confidentiality at all times.
	Problem-solving mindset and the ability to work independently with minimal supervision.

	Adaptability: Ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment with constantly evolving priorities.
	Detail-Oriented:&nbsp;Strong attention to detail, ensuring accuracy in all tasks and responsibilities.
	Proactive:&nbsp;A self-starter who can anticipate the needs of the MD and take initiative to solve problems before they arise.
	Relationship-Building:&nbsp;Ability to work effectively with both internal teams and external partners to foster collaboration and support the company&rsquo;s goals.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CVs and cover letters to:&nbsp;recruitment@domeoresources.org&nbsp;using &quot;Personal Assistant&quot; as the subject of the mail.

Personal Assistant to the Managing Director (MD) Job at Domeo Resources International (DRI) i




        
    

        
        Domeo Resources International (DRI) is a prolific organisation which proffers HR and Management Consultancy solutions premised on excellence and innovation. DRI analyses various organisational problems, develops improvement plans, deploys those plans and monitors the plans to ensure improved organisational performance.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Personal Assistant to the Managing Director (MD)
Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Reports To: Managing Director (MD)

Main Function
     

            
    




	The Personal Assistant (PA) to the MD will provide high-level executive support, enabling the MD to focus on strategic initiatives and business development.
	The ideal candidate is highly organised, resourceful, and adaptable, with excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
	The PA will act as a trusted liaison between the MD, internal stakeholders, and external partners while managing various administrative, operational, and strategic responsibilities.


Role Responsibilities
Administrative Support:


	Manage the MD’s calendar, appointments, and meetings, ensuring effective time management and prioritisation.
	Handle all correspondence, including emails, phone calls, and messages, and respond on behalf of the MD when necessary.
	Organise travel arrangements, including itineraries, flight bookings, and accommodations.


Meeting Preparation & Coordination:


	Prepare briefing materials, presentations, reports, and agendas for meetings and events.
	Attend meetings with or on behalf of the MD, taking detailed notes and following up on action points.
	Coordinate and manage logistics for internal and external meetings.


Project & Task Management:


	Assist with the coordination of key projects and initiatives across the company’s investment portfolio.
	Monitor deadlines, deliverables, and project timelines to ensure the MD stays informed and on schedule.


Stakeholder Liaison:


	Serve as the primary point of contact between the MD and stakeholders, including board members, business partners, government officials, and senior leadership.
	Facilitate the flow of information and ensure effective communication across departments.


Research & Reporting:


	Conduct research and compile information on investment opportunities, industry trends, and other topics as requested by the MD.
	Draft reports, memos, and other business documents.


Event Coordination:


	Plan and coordinate corporate events, conferences, and social functions attended by the MD.


Experience / Qualification


	A bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Management, Communications, or a related field (A bachelor’s degree in Law is preferred).
	At least 5 years of experience in a similar role providing executive support to C-suite executives or senior management, preferably in an investment, corporate, or high-growth environment.
	Experience working with high-level stakeholders, including government officials, investors, and corporate executives, is a plus.


Competencies / Skills:


	Excellent organizational and time management skills, with the ability to handle multiple priorities.
	Strong communication skills, both verbal and written.
	High level of professionalism and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build relationships across a diverse range of stakeholders.
	Proficiency in office tools such as Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and Google Workspace.
	Discretion and the ability to maintain confidentiality at all times.
	Problem-solving mindset and the ability to work independently with minimal supervision.


Behavioural Qualities / Other Competencies:


	Adaptability: Ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment with constantly evolving priorities.
	Detail-Oriented: Strong attention to detail, ensuring accuracy in all tasks and responsibilities.
	Proactive: A self-starter who can anticipate the needs of the MD and take initiative to solve problems before they arise.
	Relationship-Building: Ability to work effectively with both internal teams and external partners to foster collaboration and support the company’s goals.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CVs and cover letters to: recruitment@domeoresources.org using "Personal Assistant" as the subject of the mail.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Business Development / Sales Executive Job at Tailored Talent




        
    

        
        Tailored Talent - Our client, a growing Business Process Outsourcing (BPO) firm, is recruiting suitable candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development / Sales Executive

Job Location:  Nigeria
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Overview
     

            
    




	A growing Business Process Outsourcing (BPO) firm is hiring a goal-driven Business Development / Sales Executive to lead international client acquisition.
	The ideal candidate should have experience working with U.S. or European clients and a solid understanding of the BPO/outsourcing space.
	This role involves managing the full sales cycle from generating and qualifying leads to closing deals and reporting performance.


Key Responsibilities


	Generate and close B2B leads in the U.S. and Europe
	Conduct outbound sales via email, LinkedIn, and calls
	Manage and update sales pipeline records
	Present value propositions to decision-makers
	Track performance metrics and prepare sales reports
	Collaborate with internal teams for seamless client onboarding
	Stay informed on trends in outsourcing and remote talent


Requirements


	At least a bachelor’s degree in business, Marketing, or a related field
	3–5 years of experience in B2B sales or business development
	Proven experience working with U.S./European clients or firms
	Strong understanding of BPO, outsourcing, or remote talent services
	Excellent communication, negotiation, and closing skills
	CRM proficiency (e.g., HubSpot, Salesforce, Pipedrive)
	Able to work independently, meet sales targets, and report accurately


Bonus Qualifications:


	Experience in outsourcing or talent solution sales
	Background in tech, HR, or staffing
	Familiarity with international business etiquette.


Salary
N750,000 per month.

Deputy IT Manager Job at Bourbon Interoil Nigeria Limited




        
    

        
        Bourbon Interoil Nigeria Limited, as leading international player in marine services, offers to the most demanding oil & gas clients worldwide a full line of innovative, safe, high performance and new generation vessels and an expanded offer of offshore oil & gas services.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Deputy IT Manager
Job Location: Amadi Base, Rivers
Contract type: Permanent Contract

Roles and Responsibilities
     

            
    




	To assist the IT manager in ensuring functional and secured IT network and support to site and vessels:
	To comply with IT Best Practices and standards.
	To design and implement security policies, procedures, and protocols to protect systems and data from various threats.
	To monitor networks and systems for suspicious activity, potential vulnerabilities, and security breaches using various tools and techniques.
	To conduct regular assessments to identify weaknesses in systems and applications and simulate attacks to test the effectiveness of security measures. 
	To investigate any event/threat, identify the root cause, and implement appropriate measures to contain damage and prevent future occurrences.
	To support externa Network management and cybersecurity service providers to accomplish targets set on SLAs
	Working with vendors to procure equipment and services and managing vendor relationships. 
	Implementing and maintaining network security measures, including firewalls, intrusion detection systems, and secure protocols
	Monitoring network performance, identifying and resolving issues, and ensuring optimal network operation. 
	Managing network projects from start to finish, including planning, execution, and documentation. .
	Ensures that Documentation of all Network resources are made.
	Creating and maintaining accurate network documentation, including diagrams, configurations, and procedures.
	To provide Periodic Cyber security reports to management which provides overview of BINL security posture, key threats and mitigation strategies.
	Optimization of Telecommunications costs for all BINL sites.
	Ensure proper and on time maintenance on communication and navigational system on BINL vessels.


Qualifications, Skills and Experiences


	B.Sc / HND in Information Technology / Computer Science or a related discipline
	Masters Degree will be an added advantage
	Possession of CCNP is mandatory
	Experience with specific technologies and platforms (e.g., Cisco, Juniper, Microsoft) is mandatory
	At least one of these certifications (CompTIA Security+, Certified Ethical Hacker (CEH), Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP), and Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA).

	Proven, verifiable working experience on-board a Supply Vessel as a Chief Engineer or 2nd Engineer

Chief Engineer Job at Bourbon Interoil Nigeria Limited




        
    

        
        Bourbon Interoil Nigeria Limited, as leading international player in marine services, offers to the most demanding oil & gas clients worldwide a full line of innovative, safe, high performance and new generation vessels and an expanded offer of offshore oil & gas services.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Chief Engineer

Job Summary


	The Chief Engineer is directly responsible and accountable to the Master for the supervision and management of all technical and related departments on-board.


Roles
     

            
    




	Shall provide reliable operation of the vessel’s engines, machinery and all other mechanical equipment.
